well we still had a problem with backups I asked him about backups and he

come in here and give me the answer that I had to buy a $4,000 guaranteed for 8
hours at 4,000 de safe to put him in I asked him Tim where's your house he said
well it's on the other side of the island I said what's the possibility of this building and your house burning down he said well the volcano on the
island Mount Sarat was going off at that time and I said let's both agree you got
bigger problems if that volcano's going off and he said yep you're right so what
we did I told him I said I'm going to buy that $4,000 safe went next door to
the grocery store that was next door bought him three six-pack coolers and that's what he used for his safe he took
those coolers home day one day two day three every morning he'd bring the oldest one home give it to his systems
administrator he'd pick it up at the door as he was going out that night and he'd have his backup and that's how he
got his $4,000 save so backups offsite simple not the standard solution from an
insurance company the next thing was is we had a little problem while we were
there the power went off little islands like that tend to have a little bit of a problem with power so I asked him Tim
how long does the power go out around here oh about twice a week how long does it go out well the problem is it goes
out for an hour to two hours at a crack I said well that's good I just looked at your up systems they're good for 15
minutes and at the transaction site that's the only one we had to worry about because
that's where the money was being spent that's where we'd lose the 10 to $50,000 an hour so what I said was Tim let's go

outside I heard a diesel generator pumping away and we had already talked
about the fact that he was going to have to get some type of backup power I said I got a B idea Tim let's take the

store have an emergency generator freezer units you don't want
to have your ice cream somebody said or your meat uh thawing on you and going
bad absolutely so that's exactly what we did for $50 a month that's what he got
and it worked out fine so in summary basically when you're
going to do security base it on business first because you can put in the best piece of security that's out there and
your clients don't accept it they're going to walk on you use practical Solutions a lot of
